definition: to catch up with/to keep pace with
heel/to follow closely/to go with/(of a woman) to marry sb/with/compared with/to/towards/and (joining two nouns)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: The company also defended the sacking-by-text message(10) as a way to keep the modern.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司还辩解到，短信解聘也是跟上时代的做法。

sentences.english: England still hasn't caught up to the concept of the hyphenated identity.
sentences.chinese: 英格兰还不能跟上联众认同的观念。

sentences.english: No, I was not mad, just slow to catch up with my life's 2)revisions.
sentences.chinese: 不，我没疯，只是没跟上世道的变化罢了。

sentences.english: Maybe they want to rob her, we should follow them.
sentences.chinese: 可能是想抢劫，我们跟上去看看吧。

sentences.english: I walk, quicklynow, and he runs to keep up.
sentences.chinese: 现在我走地很快，他跑着跟上来。

sentences.english: They still do, with some now virtually the size of continents.
sentences.chinese: 它们现在仍然这样，大小几乎要跟上大陆的面积。

sentences.english: It was difficult to keep up with all the reading and essay assignments.
sentences.chinese: 跟上全部的阅读和论文作业很难。

sentences.english: We should abandon all outmoded conventions and customs to keep pace with new era.
sentences.chinese: 我们要抛弃陈规陋习以跟上新时代的步伐。

sentences.english: Bob: Maybe they want to rob her, we should follow them.
sentences.chinese: 可能是想抢劫，我们跟上去看看吧。

sentences.english: It was now dark as I peddled hard to keep up.
sentences.chinese: 天已经黑了，我费力地跟上他。

sentences.english: Banavar says Watson helps doctors keep up with information.
sentences.chinese: 巴维亚表示，沃森技术帮助医生跟上信息的潮流。

sentences.english: Of course it's possible for old folks to adapt to new technological advances.
sentences.chinese: 当然，也有可能，有些老人也会跟上高新科技的进步。

sentences.english: He waddled off and hoped Mormont would follow.
sentences.chinese: 他一瘸一拐的走开，希望莫尔蒙会跟上。

sentences.english: You walk so fast(that) I can't keep pace with you.
sentences.chinese: 你走路那么快，我无法跟上你。

sentences.english: Right turn, the first line left turn and jog, the second and third lines follow.
sentences.chinese: 向右转，第一排左转弯跑步走，后两排跟上。

sentences.english: Products of China’s garment industry should keep up with international fashion in color and tone.
sentences.chinese: 中国服装业的产品应跟上国际流行色调。

definition: to keep up with/to catch up with/to overtake/to chance upon/in time for
to pursue/to chase after/to accelerate/to catch up with/to overtake
to take advantage/to seize an opportunity/in passing/without taking extra trouble/conveniently
matching/fitting in with/compatible with/to correspond/to fit/to conform to/rapport/to coordinate with/to act in concert with/to cooperate/to become man and wife/to combine parts of machine
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
to impel/to carry forward/to push on/to advance/to drive forward
